messages.message:
I was looking for some information from Slack and have that feature enabled. It might not be added as a connector, yet, so that is fine. I think as we open up to search, we should be able to have a sense of time-sensitivity. Perhaps we could add an agent tool/step to lean in on time.

```Has anyone asked me for something I should respond to with urgency in Slack?

Response
Yes, there is an indication of an urgent request in Slack. In the "Post Mortem - 2021-07-10 FRB: Disk Full" document, it is mentioned that an escalation was raised through Slack and phone calls, which resulted in engineers being called over the phones and messaged on Slack threads over the weekend[1].```
Referring to something from 2021 as urgent is not the result I was looking for. (edited)

Thank you for this @Jason! Great feedback and yes... using metadata (e.g. creation/edited) date is one of the key improvement opps that's been surfaced by internal stakeholders of late. For consideration on our Q2 roadmap. :slightly_smiling_face:

https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-4165
